poem:
Title: The Vox Populi

Voices echo in chambers, rich with power,
Boast of scepticism drenched in hollow fear,
World's watcher, they discredit in their tower: 

Behold the WHO, bound in trial and error,
Where judgement ebbs 'neath weight of global care. 
Who can trust such yoke of duty to bear?

Yet in quiet corners of the world's heart,
Faith in endeavor blooms, dares to impart.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. She said: I am profoundly sceptical of the World Health Organisation’s ability to manage a global pandemic in light of serious errors of judgment, poor leadership and, I’m afraid, well-chronicled". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
